description: After applying the updates related to the Windows Mobile Broadband Driver, users may experience a complete denial of service. This symptom manifests as an inability to connect to network resources, leading to operational disruptions. The issue affects multiple build numbers across Windows 11 and Windows 10, including versions 24H2 (10.0.26100.2033), 23H2 (10.0.22631.4317), and 22H2 for both x64 and ARM64 systems. The associated KB articles for these updates are KB5044284, KB5044285, and KB5044273, highlighting the critical nature of this update. Administrators should monitor for this issue closely, as it restricts network availability significantly, impacting productivity and connectivity for users on the affected systems.
